column1: 1. Which of the following is the access scope of private member functions?
column2: a) Member functions which can only be used within the class
column3: b) Member functions which can used outside the class
column4: c) Member functions which are accessible in derived class
column5: d) Member functions which can’t be accessed inside the class

column1: 2. Which member can never be accessed by inherited classes?
3. Which syntax among the following shows that a member is private in a class?
4. How many private member functions are allowed in a class?
5. How to access a private member function of a class?
column4: c) Using address of member function

column2: a) Cannot be called from enclosing class
column3: b) Can be accessed from enclosing
column4: c) Can be accessed only if nested class is private
column5: d) Can be accessed only if nested class is public

column1: 7. Which error will be produced if private members are accessed?

column2: a) Functions accessible outside the class but not in derived class
column3: b) Functions accessible outside the class directly
column4: c) Functions accessible everywhere using object of class
column5: d) Functions that cannot be accessed outside the class

column1: 9. Which among the following is true for public member functions?
column2: a) Public member functions does not have a return type
column3: b) Public member functions does not have any security
column4: c) Public member functions are declared outside the class
column5: d) Public member functions can be called using object of class

column1: 10. Which type of member functions get inherited in the same specifier in which the inheritance is done?
11. Which is not a proper way to access public members of a class?
column2: a) Using object pointer with arrow operator
column3: b) Using object of class in main function
column4: c) Using object of class with arrow operator
column5: d) Using object anywhere in the program

column1: 12. Which call is correct for public members of a nested class?
column2: a) Can be called from object of enclosing class
column3: b) Can be called within enclosing class only with direct names
column4: c) Direct names should be used for the nested classes
column5: d) Only with help of nested class object pointer

column1: 13. Which of the following is not a type of constructor?

column2: a) Cannot access the private members of a class
column3: b) Cannot access the protected members of a class
column4: c) Can access only public members of a class
column5: d) Can access all the member of its class

column1: 15. When is the memory allocated for an object?
column4: c) When object constructor is called
column5: d) When object is initialized to another object
